text: was an old province of Japan in the area Okayama Prefecture on the island of Honshū.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Bitchū" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 77. Along with Bizen and Bingo Provinces, it was sometimes called . The province had borders with Hōki, Mimasaka, Bizen, and Bingo Provinces. The ancient capital city of the province was near Soja. ==History== In the Meiji period, the provinces of Japan were converted into prefectures. The maps of Japan and Bitchū Province were reformed in the 1870s.Nussbaum, "Provinces and prefectures" at p. 780. ==Shrines and Temples== Kibitsu jinja was the chief Shinto shrine (ichinomiya) of Bitchū.
